alert.note: Alert for Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 30 at 1:39PM AKDT by NWS Fairbanks
info.description: ...High Water In The Noatak, Kobuk And Koyukuk Valleys... Rains continue in the Northwest Interior with additional rainfall amounts up to 1.5 inches in the Upper Kobuk and Upper Noatak Valleys, and along the south slopes of the Western Brooks Range through Friday morning. The Kobuk river has leveled off at this time, but streams and creeks will rise to bankfull as this latest rainfall makes its way into them. Flooding is not expected, but most gravel bars will be covered by water, and logs and other debris will be floating down rivers. Rain will taper off Friday with a break through the weekend. For the latest forecasts go to www.weather.gov/fairbanks.

area.areaDesc: Lower Kobuk and Noatak Valleys; Lower Koyukuk and Middle Yukon Valleys; Upper Kobuk and Noatak Valleys
